chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonnie R. Noland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts - Child Act as Actor/Close Age of Actor and Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court
Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: The Defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall comply with the terms of the bond.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim's parents and must be approved by the Taylor County Victim/Witness Coordinator.  Defendant must successfully complete the two year probationary period.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction of this charge for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss Count 1.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant must obtain/maintain full time employment at discretion of agent.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample.  Defendant must undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Court determines after analyzing the factors under Wis. Stat. 301.45(1m)(e) that it is not necessary in the interest of public protection to require Defendant to comply with reporting requirements of the sex offender registry.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Defendant must obtain/maintain employment at agent's discretion.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample.  Defendant must write a letter of apology to the victim and victim's parents due within 30 days and pre-approved by agent.  Defendant must attend counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
Shall commence no later than 9-7-17 by 4:30 p.m.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel of the defendant, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Restitution shall be paid from defendant's bond of $1,000.00.  Balance of the bond shall be applied to court costs.
The unpaid costs shall be reduced to a civil judgment.  The payment of costs shall be addressed at a later date.

The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  The jail sentence shall be served with huber and good time.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Court calls Case Nos. 15CF63, 17CF82, 17CF101, & 17CF102.  Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty places agreement on the record.  17CF82 - DE entered a plea of no contest.  17CF101 - DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1.  17CF102 - DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily and intelligently; accepts plea; find DE guilty.  15CF63 - Victim makes statement.  Argument on sex offender registry.  Court orders a withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 8 years with the following conditions:  court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain/maintain full time employment at discretion of agent.  Court finds sex offender registry is not appropriate in this matter and it is not necessary for public protection for DE to register per Wis. Stat. 301.45(1m)(e). 17CF82 - Court imposed payment of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; 60 days in Taylor County Jail, consecutive to 17CF101 & 17CF102, with Huber and good time granted. 62 days sentence credit.   17CF101 - Count 1 - Court imposed the following sentence: 8 years in Wisconsin State Prison consisting of 4 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision with conditions of: court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; Reimbursement of $50 to the Taylor County Sheriff's Dept.; Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain/maintain full time employment, at the discretion of agent.  Count 2 was dismissed, but read in.  17CF102 - Court imposed the following sentence: 8 years in Wisconsin State Prison consisting of 4 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision with conditions of: court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; Reimbursement of $50 to the Taylor County Sheriff's Department; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain/maintain full time employment at discretion of agent.  Court determines DE is elegible for substance abuse program.  DE is not elegible for the challenge incarceration program.  Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5 were dismissed, but read in. ba

Court calls case nos. 15CF63, 16CF56, 16CF82, 17CF82, 17CF101, 17CF102. Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in custody.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed on 17CF82, 17CF101 & 17CF102 - based on waiver court bound DE over for trial.  Information filed by the state.  DE waived further reading of same and entered pleas of not guilty to all the charges.  Matters are set for plea and sentencing at a later date.  16CF56 & 16CF82 - Atty Tlusty states joint recommendation.  Atty Nocco makes statement. Court imposed 1 year in Taylor County Jail with Huber and good time concurrent to each other; 123 days sentence credit; court costs reduced to civil a judgment.  Atty Nocco requests a few days of furlough in order for DE to see his grandmother who is ill.  State objects.  Court denies request. ba
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 24, 2018 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 - Court satisfied that the defendant has violated the deferred agreement and the court revokes his deferred entry of judgment agreement and finds the defendant guilty.  Court defers sentencing to a later date.  Court orders bond to be applied towards restitution then unpaid costs on count 2.  Count 2 - Court orders nine months jail with good time and huber; restitution and costs.  Unpaid costs are reduced to a civil judgment.  Payment plan can be addressed at a later date.  35 days sentence credit.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 20, 2017 at 09:45 am. - rt

Court calls case Nos. 15CF63, 16CF56, 16CV27 & 16CF82.  Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty placed agreement on the record.  15CF63 - DE entered a plea of no contest to Cts. 1 & amended Ct. 2.  16CF56 - DE entered a plea of no contest to amended Ct. 1. 16CF82 - DE entered a plea of not contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists. Court found plea given freely, voluntarily & intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty.  Argument on jail sentence.  15CF63 - Ct. 1 - Pursuant to the agreement the court deferred entry of judgment of conviction for two years and signed agreement.  Ct. 2 - Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:  6 months county jail with Huber; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; obtain/maintain employment; letter of apology to victim & victim's parents due within 30 days; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; restitution to be determined within 30 days.  16CV27 - Court dismissed case.  16CF56 - Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions: 6 months county jail with Huber and concurrent to 15CF63; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Court read in, but dismissed Cts. 2 - 5. 16CF82 - Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 9 months county jail with Huber and concurrent to 15CF63 & 16CF56; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Court dismissed, but read in Cts. 2 & 3. ba
